Title: Predicting human resting-state functional connectivity from structural connectivity.
Structural measure (diffusion): Connection density (number of connections per unit surface)
Correlation: 1) Low resolution, all connections: 0.66 2) Low resolution, removing absent/inconsistent connections: 0.82 3) High resolution, all connections: 0.36 4) High resolution, removing absent/inconsistent connections: 0.53

Title: Measuring brain connectivity: diffusion tensor imaging validates resting state temporal correlations.
Structural measure (diffusion): Weighted sum of connections; with penalizing more indirect pathways

Title: The neonatal connectome during preterm brain development.
Age: Between week 30 and week 42 of corrected gestational age

Title: Network diffusion accurately models the relationship between structural and functional brain connectivity networks.
The structural–functional connectome and the default mode network of the human brain.
Structural measure (diffusion): Number or random walks (probabilistic tractography (Prob)) and Number of fibers (global tracking (Global))
Correlation: 1) Prob. Full: 0.046 ± 0.018 (0.02–0.08) 2) Global. Full 0.017 ± 0.010 (0.006–0.02) 3) Prob. Partial: 0.024 ± 0.029. 4) Global. Partial 0.015 ± 0.017. (Individual participants)

Title: Disrupted functional brain connectivity and its association to structural connectivity in amnestic mild cognitive impairment and Alzheimer's disease.
Structural measure (diffusion): Fiber numbers connecting each pair of brain regions
Correlation: 1) All connections: 0.37. 2) Excluding absent structural connections: 0.51.

Title: Mapping the structural core of human cerebral cortex.
Structural measure (diffusion): Deterministic tractography; connection density (number of connections per unit surface)

Title: Altered functional and structural connectivity networks in psychogenic non-epileptic seizures.
Functional measure: Absolute functional connectivity strength; correlation coefficient

Title: White matter maturation reshapes structural connectivity in the late developing human brain.
Structural measure (diffusion): Product between connection density & apparent diffusion coefficient (ADC)
Correlation: 1) Young: low resolution: 0.30 2) Young: high resolution: 0.36 3) Old: low resolution: 0.43 4) Old: high resolution: 0.46

Title: Abnormal rich club organization and functional brain dynamics in schizophrenia
Correlation: 1) Cortical: 0.25 ± 0.048 (mean ± SD) 2) Whole brain: 0.19 ± 0.049 (mean ± SD) 3) Cortical: 0.25 ± 0.062 (mean ± SD) 4) Whole brain: 0.18 ± 0.051 (mean ± SD)

Title: A cross-modal, cross-species comparison of connectivity measures in the primate brain.
Structural measure (diffusion): Probabilistic tractography: Streamline density (amount of tracts divided by distance and region size

Title: Structural architecture supports functional organization in the human brain at a region wise and network level.
Structural measure (diffusion): Probabilistic fiber tracking: Number of voxels between a pair of regions, weighted to surface area and corrected for mean tract length
Functional measure: Fisher's Z transformed Pearson’s correlation coefficient
p: 1 and 2) p<0.001 for all subjects 3 and 4) Not reported

Title: Structure–function relationships during segregated and integrated network states of human brain functional connectivity.
Structural measure (diffusion): Number of streamlines divided by geometric mean of surface areas
Functional measure: Fisher’s Z transformed Pearson correlation coefficient
Correlation: 1) Integrated state: ∼0.27 2) Segregated state: ∼0.22 (Estimated from graph)

Title: Whole-brain analytic measures of network communication reveal increased structure–function correlation in right temporal lobe epilepsy.
Resting-brain functional connectivity predicted by analytic measures of network communication.
Correlation: 1) Average all 3 datasets: r = 0.515. 2) Average all 3 datasets: r = 0.338.

Title: Affected anatomical rich club and structural–functional coupling in young offspring of schizophrenia and bipolar disorder patients.
Structural measure (diffusion): Number of streamlines rescaled to a Gaussian distribution
